info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 16 at 3:38AM MDT until June 17 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... The National Weather Service in Glasgow has issued a Heat Advisory, which is in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM MDT Friday. The Lake Wind Advisory has been cancelled. * HEAT INDEX VALUES...Up to 95 due to temperatures in the upper 90s, and dewpoints in the mid 50s. * TIMING...from 11 am to 9 pm on Friday. * IMPACTS...The combination of early season hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a situation in which heat illnesses are possible.
info.instruction: A Heat Advisory means that a period of hot temperatures is expected. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water. To reduce risk during outdoor work...the occupational safety and health administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency...call 9 1 1.
